thread.title: Gasoline Prices to Tick Downwards As Oil Glut Remains
thread.title_full: Gasoline Prices to Tick Downwards As Oil Glut Remains

title: Gasoline Prices to Tick Downwards As Oil Glut Remains
text:
Gasoline Prices to Tick Downwards As Oil Glut Remains 09/04/2015 - 9:42 AM EDT 
NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) — Good news for those hitting the road over Labor Day weekend: prices for crude oil will continue to decline for an extended period as downward pressure continues with a global oil gut. 
That means gas prices for the holiday weekend are down 30% from a year ago, and the drop is not fading away in the near term, said Bernard Weinstein, associate director of the Maguire Energy Institute at Southern Methodist University’s Cox School of Business in Dallas. 
“At a national average price of $2.40 per gallon, Americans traveling over the Labor Day weekend will be paying less for gasoline than at any time since the Great Recession of 2009,” he said. More Headlines
